The pilot stated he had his oxygen mask on.
The pilot stated he was not hypoxic.

The pilot's major concern was to avoid stalling the airplane.
The pilot's major concern was to avoid spinning the airplane.
The pilot kept both hands on the yoke to prevent the airplane from pitching up.
The pilot did not attempt to use the manual trim wheel.
The pilot did not attempt to use the autopilot controls.

Using the autopilot controls would have required the pilot to release hand pressure on the control yoke.

The pilot reported achieving a "quasi-stable descent with a rapid spiral descent."
At 0901:59, the pilot told ATC that he was at 10,000 feet.
The pilot told ATC he was having trouble controlling the airplane.
The airplane continued to want to stall.
The pilot encountered multiple violent pitch up oscillations near the bottom of the descent.
The pilot encountered multiple violent pitch down oscillations near the bottom of the descent.
The pilot seat broke during one of the oscillations.
The broken pilot seat allowed the pilot to use his knees to apply forward pressure to the yoke.

The pilot stated he might be able to take the airplane down.
The pilot told ATC that he would take anything, including landing in a field.
The pilot was having a "devil of a time controlling the plane."
The airplane continued heading southwest.
The pilot decided to try to land at ADG.

text:
# Incident Report

## Pilot's Encounter with Emergencies

* At 11,000 feet msl, the pilot told ATC that he had to declare an emergency as he could not hold the plane.
* At 0851:29, another aircraft on the radio reported that the accident pilot sounded hypoxic and needed to get his oxygen mask on.
* The pilot stated that he had his oxygen mask on and was not hypoxic, but the task of maintaining control of the airplane was taking his focused attention, resulting in sporadic and less clear radio calls.
* The pilot's major concern was to avoid stalling and spinning the airplane, so he kept both hands on the yoke to prevent the airplane from pitching up.
* The pilot did not attempt to use the manual trim wheel or the autopilot controls, as that would have required him to release hand pressure on the control yoke.
* At 0852:07, the pilot told ATC that he had to descend, and he reported achieving a "quasi-stable descent with a rapid spiral descent."
* At 0901:59, the pilot told ATC that he was at 10,000 feet and was having trouble controlling the airplane, which continued to want to stall.
* The pilot encountered multiple violent pitch up and down oscillations near the bottom of the descent, and the pilot seat was broken during one of the oscillations, allowing him to use his knees to apply forward pressure to the yoke.
* At 0906:18, the pilot stated that he had finally got the airplane under control at 3,000 feet and might be able to take it down.
* The pilot told ATC that he would take anything, including landing in a field, as he was having a "devil of a time controlling the plane."
* The airplane continued heading southwest and the pilot decided to try to land at ADG, where he ended up in a hard landing in the grass short of runway 23.

## Personnel Information
No additional personnel information was provided.

---
